title: Configuartion [Sensitive] Information Disclosure
vulnerability_information:
Report Submission Form

Hello Team,

The Configuration Details are being leaked by the following url:  https://prow.k8s.io/config

## Steps to Reproduce

Click on the Below link to reproduce the issue - 
https://prow.k8s.io/config

## Impact

The Sensitive Information is being leaked. This information can be used to launch further attacks.
vulnerability_information_html:
Report Submission Form

Hello Team,

The Configuration Details are being leaked by the following url: https://prow.k8s.io/config

Steps to Reproduce

Click on the Below link to reproduce the issue -
https://prow.k8s.io/config

Impact

The Sensitive Information is being leaked. This information can be used to launch further attacks.

activities.message: Hi @barsainya - Thanks for the report. Specifically, what information found at `https://prow.k8s.io/config` is sensitive?
activities.markdown_message: Hi @barsainya - Thanks for the report. Specifically, what information found at https://prow.k8s.io/config is sensitive?

Hello @tuxedo,
Thanks for your Response :)
As far as I can test the URL https://prow.k8s.io/config is pointing towards the Configuration File which is having YAML syntax. (YAML Syntax is generally used in Ansible Files for doing Configurations of Servers)

This is a huge File which contains lots of Sensitive and Juicy Information Such as Path of Credentials, Metadata Path, Port Number, Cron Jobs, routing info, information about CPU, Memory, names of executable files, python scripts, Network name, MTU, Node name, Disk Size, CPU Architecture and much more.............

As you can see that it is a huge file and it is a configuration file. It contain much information about the server and it's configuration. Why this file is publicly accessible ?? An attacker can learn many things from these details and can plan attack strategy according to it. This Endpoint must be removed

Kindly Check the Few Screenshots attached below -

Hidden Repos, Github Team ids

Credential Details, Paths where Credentials are Stored, Image name

Details about Mounting Points, Secret Name, Hashing Algorithms

Executable Files, Python Scripts

About Google application Credentials, Path of Jenkins Credentials

Information About Cron Jobs

AWS Related Information leaks

Network Name, Version, MTU, Routing Info

Metadata Paths, Remote Endpoints

Port Number, Paths

*Usernames, Passwords



CPU, Memory, Resources

Node Name, Disk Size, CPU Architecture

Thanks and Best Wishes :)

Kind Regards

MAYANK BARSAINYA

activities.message: Hi @barsainya - I'm discussing this submission internally with the Kubernetes team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @barsainya - I'm discussing this submission internally with the Kubernetes team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

activities.message: Hi @barsainya - After discussing this report internally with the Kubernetes team, it was concluded that none of the values found in this config file are considered sensitive, it's simply a build config. As such, this report will be closed as `Informative`. Your effort is appreciated nonetheless, and best of luck on your future bug hunting!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @barsainya - After discussing this report internally with the Kubernetes team, it was concluded that none of the values found in this config file are considered sensitive, it's simply a build config. As such, this report will be closed as Informative. Your effort is appreciated nonetheless, and best of luck on your future bug hunting!

activities.message: Since we haven't heard back within the 30 day window, we're going to go ahead and disclose this report.
activities.markdown_message: Since we haven't heard back within the 30 day window, we're going to go ahead and disclose this report.
